main_topic.author: Kishan Vavdara
main_topic.title: Is Microsoft phi3 allowed?
main_topic.content: I noticed in some competitions that the host specifies certain dates after which models released are not allowed. This competition was launched on May 2nd, and phi3 was released on April 23rd under the MIT license. So, could you [@sohier](https://www.kaggle.com/sohier) [@paultimothymooney](https://www.kaggle.com/paultimothymooney) please confirm if we can use that model?

comments.author: Kishan VavdaraTopic Author
comments.content: Hello, [@mylesoneill](https://www.kaggle.com/mylesoneill) [@addisonhoward](https://www.kaggle.com/addisonhoward) Could you please confirm? I can't find that anywhere on competition page.
comments.date: Posted 2 months ago  ·  38th in this Competition

reply.author: Addison Howard
reply.content:
Hi Kishan,

The Kaggle team cannot make license or rule interpretations for you or our hosts. I will note, however, that the only competition with a specified date relating to model releases is the AIMO competition, and that rule does not apply to other competitions.

reply.author: Kishan VavdaraTopic Author
reply.content: Thank you so much for clarifying. Indeed, I read that somewhere in the AIMO competition rules.

reply.author: Kishan VavdaraTopic Author
reply.content: I haven't done extensive experiments with phi3 yet, but I've found it to be much better than other models of similar size. So far, it hasn't performed on par with llama-3. The best score I've achieved with till now is 0.994 and i think can still push further.
